game.IOStuff

Class ScoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.IOStuff.IOManager
      • game.IOStuff.GameIOManager
        • game.IOStuff.ScoreManager

  • public class ScoreManager
extends GameIOManager
    This class allows one to save and/or load high score information. Simply make sure to have passed in the appropriate player object into this manager beforehand. Dependencies: GameIOManager class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScoreManager()
      Default constructor
      ScoreManager(ArrayList<String> someScoreData)
      Constructor for if some user-defined score data file a already exists in some fashion.
      ScoreManager(Player aPlayer)
      Constructor for if the user defined player object is already available.
      ScoreManager(Player aPlayer, ArrayList<String> someScoreData)
      Constructor for if the player object is already available, as well as user defined score data too.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ArrayList<String> getScoreData()
      This method loads up the score data and returns it, in the form of an ArrayList.
      void load()
      This method calls the superclass load method to load the information in the file up.
      void save()
      This method saves the name of the player as well as the percentage increase or decrease in their net worth compared to their starting money - this being their score.
      void setScoreData(ArrayList<String> someScoreData)
      This method sets the score data.

      • Methods inherited from class game.IOStuff.GameIOManager

        getPlayer, load, save, setPlayer

      • Methods inherited from class game.IOStuff.IOManager

        ensureDirectoryExistance, extractedInfo, getFileName, setFileName

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScoreManager

        public ScoreManager()
        Default constructor

      • ScoreManager

        public ScoreManager(ArrayList<String> someScoreData)
        Constructor for if some user-defined score data file a already exists in some fashion.
        Parameters:
        someScoreData - A user defined ArrayList which contains the user's desired score file data.

      • ScoreManager

        public ScoreManager(Player aPlayer)
        Constructor for if the user defined player object is already available. Expected to be the most used constructor since the user's player object is necessary to get score data relevant to one's interests.

      • ScoreManager

        public ScoreManager(Player aPlayer,
                    ArrayList<String> someScoreData)
        Constructor for if the player object is already available, as well as user defined score data too.
        Parameters:
        aPlayer - An object of type player corresponding to the current player object in the game.
        someScoreData - An ArrayList corresponding to the scoreData.

    • Method Detail

      • getScoreData

        public ArrayList<String> getScoreData()
                               throws IOException
        This method loads up the score data and returns it, in the form of an ArrayList. Dependencies: This class' load() method.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • load

        public void load()
          throws IOException
        This method calls the superclass load method to load the information in the file up. All it does is load the info to the scoreData attribute; it doesn't do anything else!
        Throws:
        IOException

      • save

        public void save()
          throws IOException
        This method saves the name of the player as well as the percentage increase or decrease in their net worth compared to their starting money - this being their score. Warning: This method USES THE CURRENT PLAYER OBJECT IN THIS CLASS! What this means is that you should ensure the player object is up to date before invoking this method.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setScoreData

        public void setScoreData(ArrayList<String> someScoreData)
        This method sets the score data. It is the setter.
